result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Brian Frank was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Brian Frank was found guilty of Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).
  • Brian Frank was found guilty of Knowingly Operating While Revoked (Cause Great Bodily Harm), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Brian Frank was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 20 jobs per month and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not possess or consume alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns unless for employment reasons.

records.addlTxt: #1 - series of pictures from victim; #2 - certified driving record of defendant

Called at 2:26 PM. Also called 13TR458, 14TR121, 14TR122, 14CF22, 14CF111 and 14TR130. Brian Frank appears in person and with counsel Timothy Drewa. State appears by Charles Simono. 14CF111 - Drewa has complaint, waives reading, requests PH, will waive time limits. Court considers time limits waived, continues bond, set for PH on 11/11/14 at 1:15 PM. Drewa argues bond on that matter, asks for signature bond for stated reasons. State - bond - no objections for stated reasons. Court - bond - reduce bond to $2500.00 signature bond with same conditions - refund bond to poster. Court - court has plea questionnaire - 13CF104 - plead G to count #1 and #2 as alleged, #3 - DRI; 14CF22 - plead G to count #1, #3, #5 and #7 as alleged and DRI remaining counts (#2, #4, #6, #8 and #9); court goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - 14TR130 - plead to as alleged - Frank pleads G - finds G - pay fine on citation, dismisses 14TR121 and 14TR122. State - find 13TR548 reasonable and dismiss. Frank makes statement, remorseful. Drewa - plan to go to sentencing today - no PSI. Court reviews files - will proceed to sentencing today and will not order a PSI. Court finds G of all charges plead to, DRI and reads in all other counts, has reviewed the victim impact statement and has reviewed exhibits #1 - packet of photos provided by victim and exhibit #2 - certified driving record of defendant. State - checked with victim on 14CF111 and if dismissed - count #7 would be a different disposition of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 3 years, consecutive to all other cases - at end of the 5 years probation on count #3 - with a fine of $3000 plus costs and no other specific conditions. Recess to discuss with defendant. Back on record at 3:04 PM. Court reiterates that all previous statements still apply and makes sure he understands what the new disposition on count #7 would be. Frank understands - makes statement - is willing to proceed in this matter, Drewa agrees. State - this disposition was discussed before and is just being re-offered. Court - plea questionnaire waiver still stands as do the factual basis. Court has reviewed the written victim impact statements and has reviewed the pictures submitted. State - has complied with victim notification in both matters and has not had any feedback from the victim in 13CF104 and the victim is present in the courtroom in the 14CF22 case and has submitted the restitution report/order to the Court - 13CF104 - count #1 - 3.5 years in prison consisting of 1.6 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES, fine of $4281.00 inclusive of costs, 60 month DL revocation, reimburse FOSO for $35.00 blood draw, #2 - $500 fine plus costs; 14CF22 - #1 - 6 years in prison consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES - consecutive to 13CF104 but concurrent to #5 - 10 years in prison consisting of 5 years of initial confinment followed by 5 years of ES - concurrent to 13CF104 and count #1 on this case, 14CF22 - #1 - fine of $7329.00, 36 month DL suspension, $35 blood draw to FOSO, #7 - withhold sentence and place on probation - consecutive to ES on #3 with a $3000 fine plus costs, all other counts just asking for costs, recites restitution report/order for M.B. on 14CF22 - $2959.03 - VW surcharge of $295.90 for a total restitution amount of $3254.93. Victim makes statement. Drewa makes argument prior to sentencing - asks court to follow joint recommendation. Frank withholds additional comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 13CF104 - count #1 - 3.5 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 1.6 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of extended supervision, fine of $4281.00 inclusive of costs - take bond posted, 60 month DL revocation, $35.00 blood draw costs to FOSO; IID, DNA sample; #2 - $500.00 fine plus costs - take bond posted, 36 month DL revocation, not eligible for challenge incarceration or earned release; 14CF22 - count #1 - 6 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES - consecutive to prison time on 13CF104, $7329.00 fine inclusive of costs - take bond posted, restitution as reported on submitted restitution report/order, 36 month DL revocation, IID, $35.00 blood draw costs to FOSO, #3 - $1- plus costs; #5 - 10 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 5 years of intial confinement followed by 5 years of ES, concurrent to 13CF104, check with jail for jail credit on either case, $10.00 plus costs; #7 - 30 days jail, concurrent to other jail in 14CF22, 3000 fine plus costs; ES/probation conditions: no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bar or taverns unless for employment issues, job search - 20 places/month, right to appeal, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, not eligible for sbustance abuse or earned release, dismiss 14CF111, dismiss all other citations, 13TR348 - finds reasonable and dismisses, take all bonds posted and remainder sent back to poster if any, State withdraws motion to forfeit bond.

Called at 9:48 AM. Also called traffic matters and 14CF22. Brian Frank appears in person and with counsel Tim Drewa who has replaced Attorney Jeff Jackomono for stated reasons. . Drewa responds, has tried to meet with DA but he was unavailable for stated reasons, possibly schedule for another FPT. Court - JT on 13CF104 will stay as scheduled. Drewa informs Court that he anticipates 3 witnesses. Court expects to see witness list by close of business (4:00 PM on 7/29/14). State has no objections to scheduling this matter for another FPT for stated reasons. Drewa has all discovery on both cases but needs time to review it. State instructs Drewa that he has received documents from another attorney regarding 14CF22 and will provide that to Drewa as well. State can contact Court if they reach a global resolution - bail bond hearing will be set at same time as well.

Called at 10:50 AM. Also called 13CF104 and all traffic matters. Brian Frank appears in person and with counsel Jeff Jackomino. State appears by Charles Simono. Jackomino - 14CF22 - has Information, waives reading, enters NG pleas to all counts that case. Jackomino - 13CF104 - originally set for PLEAS but believes the original proposal is now withdrawn due to new charges and set that case for JT. State agrees - will be looking at expediting both matters due to retirement of defense counsel (Attorney Tim Drewa will probably be taking case over). Court accepts pleas on 14CF22, continues bond on both matters, court sets 13CF104 for JT on 7/29/14 at 8:30 AM (backing up another JT). State prefers to have any analyst in Court. Court agrees. Set 14CF22 for PTC on same date and time and track all citations. Court - witness lists need to be in 5/23/14 at 4:00 PM, set 13CF104 for PTC on 7/22/14 at 9:30 AM.

Called at 11:17 AM. Brian Frank appears in person and with counsel Jeff Jackomino. State appears by Charles Simono. State puts stipulations on record - accept offer of proof on the extent of injuries to one of the victims, venue and identification, admission of the officer's report without assessing his testimony. State - makes statement in regards to victim MB's injuries (Jackomio agrees as stated by State). Court will accept for purposes of today's hearing. Jackomino - also stipulate for today's hearing only to prior convictions as stated. State offers exhibit #1 and #2 with Jackomino stipulates to both exhibits (State will provide copies to Jackimono). Court goes off record to read exhibit #2 (Officer Collette's report). Back on record at 11:23 AM. State calls Megan Quade. Quade sworn in at 11:23 AM. Direct exam by State. Cross exam by Jackomino at 11:28 AM. Re-direct by State at 11:32 AM. Quade excused at 11:32 AM. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for trial. State will file an Information today and includes the PAC. Jackomino will waive readiing of Information, set for ARGN and PTC on 5/6/14 at 10:00 AM. Clerk will send notice. Court reminds the defendnat to not drink and/or drive.

If medical personnel (doctor or registered nurse) can confirm that the mother (Pamela Winkler) of defendant's child is going into labor by contacting the FOSO, he may be released from the jail for 12 hours and will be required to travel directly to Saint Mary's Hospital and remain there for the birth of his child and if the labor and birth takes longer than 12 hours, a doctor or registered nurse may contact the FOSO (provide necessary releases to allow that contact) and the Court will extend the furlough for an additional 12 hours and once the birth is concluded, he will need to return to FOSO either at the end of the 12 hour extension or within 3 hours after the birth of the child.
Preliminary hearing on March 19, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Called at 4:07 PM. Brian Frank appears in person and in custody with attorney Jeff Jackomiono. State appears by Charles Simono. Judge Bloom is appearing telephonically from Oneida County. Jackomino has complaint, waives formal reading of it, requests PH and would like to address bond. Jackomino makes argument for bond - asks for reduction in bond ($7500.00 cash) for stated reasons. State - bond - objects to reduction in bond for stated reasons and would like the cash bond rasied to $30,000.00 cash. Court - bond - continues bond as previously set. Court will need to set for PH within. Court sets for PH on 3/19/14 at 11:00 AM. Jackomino asking for furlough for the birth of the child. Court asks question. State - would like more information on the date and place of birth. Court - will amend bond to state: if medical personnel (doctor or registered nurse) can confirm that the mother (Pamela Winkler) of defendant's child is going into labor by contacting the FOSO, he may be released from the jail for 12 hours and will be required to travel directly to Saint Mary's Hospital and remain there for the birth of his child and if the labor and birth takes longer than 12 hours, a doctor or registered nurse may contact the FOSO (provide necessary releases to allow that contact) and the Court will extend the furlough for an additional 12 hours and once the birth is concluded, he will need to return to FOSO either at the end of the 12 hour extension or within 3 hours after the birth of the child.
Bail/bond hearing on March 12, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 12, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
